body_html:
@apaszke That is true if you don't resort to data augmentation. In my case, i needed to use several augmentation functions to overcome data shortage, which are

 # I think you can guess what they do from their names
[gaussian_3d, calibration, elastic_transform, flipud_3d, fliplr_3d, rotate_3d, to_tensor]

They effectively make the dataset thousands times bigger, so it was impractical to load the all cases of augmentations into memory.

body:
@apaszke That is true if you don't resort to data augmentation. In my case, i needed to use several augmentation functions to overcome data shortage, which are
```python
 # I think you can guess what they do from their names
[gaussian_3d, calibration, elastic_transform, flipud_3d, fliplr_3d, rotate_3d, to_tensor] 
```
 They effectively make the dataset thousands times bigger, so it was impractical to load the all cases of augmentations into memory.
